name: Christian Andersson Naesseth
content: Elemental AI | Christian A. Naesseth I am an Assistant Professor of Machine Learning at the University of Amsterdam, a member of the Amsterdam Machine Learning Lab, the lab manager of the UvA-Bosch Delta Lab 2, and an ELLIS member. My research interests span generative modeling, uncertainty quantification, reasoning, and machine learning, as well as their application to the sciences. I am currently working on generative models (diffusions, flows, generative flow networks, …), approximate inference (variational and Monte Carlo methods), probabilistic modelling (natural sciences, computer vision, health, etc.), uncertainty quantification and hypothesis testing (E-values, conformal prediction, …). Previously, I was a postdoctoral research scientist with David Blei at the Data Science Institute, Columbia University. I completed my PhD in Electrical Engineering at Linköping University, advised by Fredrik Lindsten and Thomas Schön. News Oct 22, 2025 TMLR announces new Journal-to-Conference track and certifications. The lab and collaborators are excited to present two J2C certified papers (top 10%): Variational Pseudo Marginal Methods for Jet Reconstruction in Particle Physics E-Valuating Classifier Two-Sample Tests Oct 6, 2025 The lab welcomes Markus Mueller, a visiting PhD student from Erasmus University Rotterdam. Sep 19, 2025 Decisions for NeurIPS are out! The lab and collaborators are excited to present 2 (out of 2!) accepted papers: Monitoring Risks in Test-Time Adaptation Reverse Diffusion Sequential Monte Carlo Samplers Stay tuned for code and camera-ready versions! Sep 18, 2025 Congratulations to Dr. Heiko Zimmermann who successfully defended his thesis, Variational Inference for Probabilistic Programs and Generative Models, yesterday! Jun 13, 2025 Camera-ready for UAI is out! The lab and collaborators are excited to present 1 (out of 1!) accepted paper: On Continuous Monitoring of Risk Violations under Unknown Shift and code. May 7, 2025 Decisions for ICML are out! The lab and collaborators are excited to present 2 (out of 2!) accepted papers: SDE Matching: Scalable and Simulation-Free Training of Latent Stochastic Differential Equations Controlled Generation with Equivariant Variational Flow Matching Stay tuned for code and camera-ready versions! May 1, 2025 The lab welcomes Fabian Denoodt, a visiting PhD student from Antwerp University. Apr 29, 2025 SDE Matching wins Best Workshop Paper Award at AABI 2025! Mar 5, 2025 Excited to attend the BIRS Workshop: Efficient Approximate Bayesian Inference next week to discuss approximate inference on the panel for Challenges & Opportunities in VI, and give a talk on our latest work on SDE Matching! Feb 17, 2025 The lab welcomes Bahrul Nasution, a Turing Scheme visiting PhD student from the University of Manchester. Feb 14, 2025 Looking forward to attend the MFO Mini-Workshop: Statistical Challenges for Deep Generative Models next week to discuss generative models and give a talk on our latest work on SDE Matching and Neural Flow Diffusion Models! Jan 22, 2025 Decisions for AISTATS are out! The lab and collaborators are excited to present 2 (out of 2!) accepted papers: Max-Rank: Efficient Multiple Testing for Conformal Prediction Variational Combinatorial Sequential Monte Carlo for Bayesian Phylogenetics in Hyperbolic Space Stay tuned for code and camera-ready versions! Jan 1, 2025 The lab is glad to welcome a new postdoc, Hany Abdulsamad, to the team. Nov 1, 2024 I will give the keynote at the NeurIPS Fest 2024 event in Amsterdam on November 28, co-organised by the ELLIS units in Amsterdam, Delft, and Nijmegen. Sep 26, 2024 Decisions for NeurIPS are out! The lab and collaborators are excited to present no less than 5 (out of 5!) accepted papers: Neural Flow Diffusion Models Equivariant Neural Diffusion for Molecule Generation Fast yet Safe: Early-Exiting with Risk Control VISA: Variational Inference with Sequential Sample-Average Approximations Variational Flow Matching for Graph Generation Stay tuned for camera-ready versions and code! Sep 9, 2024 I am looking forward to attend and present our work on improving diffusion models at the Generative models and uncertainty quantification workshop in Copenhagen next week! Aug 26, 2024 I am currently recruiting a postdoc to work with me. The postdoc will be embedded within the UvA-Bosch Delta Lab 2 and AMLab. Apply here, I will be reviewing applications on a rolling basis till the position is filled. Jul 19, 2024 We will attend AABI and ICML July 21-27 in Vienna, Austria. The lab and collaborators are presenting several exciting contributions: Neural Diffusion Models (conference) Equivariant Neural Diffusion for Molecule Generation (AI4Science workshop) Fast yet Safe: Early-Exiting with Risk Control (SPIGM/ES-FOMO-II workshop) Reach out if you would like to chat about probabilistic machine learning, generative modelling, uncertainty quantification, or their application to the sciences! Jul 1, 2024 The lab welcomes Raghuram D R, a visiting PhD student from Bielefeld University to work on generative models for genomics. Mar 1, 2024 The lab welcomes François Cornet, a visiting PhD student from the Technical University of Denmark - DTU. Feb 14, 2024 I am delighted to announce that I will serve as program chair for the 6th Symposium on Advances in Approximate Bayesian Inference AABI 2024 co-located with ICML 2024. This year we are introducing an archival option for full papers! Dec 21, 2023 I am currently recruiting a postdoc to work with me. The postdoc will be embedded within the UvA-Bosch Delta Lab 2 and AMLab. Apply here, deadline is February 4, 2024. Dec 18, 2023 Starting in 2024 I will take over as the lab manager for the UvA-Bosch Delta Lab 2. Jul 10, 2023 I am looking forward to attend and present our work on diffusion models at the 2023 ELLIS unConference in Paris coincident with ICML in Hawaii in 2 weeks! Feb 28, 2023 I am (co-)organizing the 5th Symposium on Advances in Approximate Bayesian Inference AABI 2023 co-located with ICML 2023. Dec 16, 2022 I am delighted to be invited to attend and give a talk at the CMStatistics special invited session on Grand challenges and advances in Bayesian computation. Sep 1, 2022 I am very glad to welcome a new PhD Candidate, Grigory Bartosh, to the lab. Aug 25, 2022 I will attend and give a talk at the Second Workshop on Monte Carlo and Approximate Dynamic Programming Methods. Aug 9, 2022 I am serving as a Workflow Chair for AISTATS 2023.
